memories.title: In memory of Leona Henry
memories.description: A great leader and a good friend are what many HSBC colleagues would use to describe Leona. After joining as a graduate she soon rose through the ranks with her attention to detail and here non-stop attitude to learn new things. She was married to Andrew and loved walking in the Welsh hills.

comments.comment: We miss you and the way you lead us, you're always be in our hearts.
Rest in peace from all your friends at HSBC I'll miss our morning chats beside the coffee machine!.

memories.message: No flowers please, donations to local charities only

memories.title: In memory of Derek Osmond
memories.description: Derek or Des to those who knew him joined HSBC in 1979 and only planned to stay for 6 months! Although after 20 years service he certainly left his mark and many will have fond memories..

comments.comment: Rest in peace from all your friends at HSBC.

memories.message: Great manager who led the team to many successful outcomes. He'll be missed by all

memories.title: In memory of Shirley J
memories.description: Shirley was born in Chicago, US in September 1966, always a person with a high perspective of life and vision for work, one of the best specialists and leaders here. She had a deep for music and often found happiness in listening to her favourite songs.

comments.comment: We miss you and the way you lead us, you're always be in our hearts.
Thank you for everything, I will miss you, you showed love by showing love.

memories.message: Had memorial for family and friends at the Baxter Chapel of Hooper and Huddlestone Funeral Home. Burial was at the Dobbs Cemetery.

memories.title: William M (Bill)
memories.description: Bill was born in Minessota in Decemner 1956, was married to Karen (Karki) and started a family that grew to include two boys. A person with a good sense of humour.

comments.comment: We miss you and the way you lead us, you're always be in our hearts.

You were always nice and helped me in the most difficult moments. I will miss the way you solved problems and encouraged us to continue even when you could have a bad day, thank you very much for so much.
Rest in peace from all your friends at HSBC.
Thank you for all the help and advice over the years Derek.
Rest in peave Derek! I don't know who I'll play golf with now every Sunday.

memories.message: if you want to send flowers, please contact his wife 00-677-4567-345
